column1: Arming Libyan rebels has a military impact on the rebels' combat abilities and in ousting Gaddafi from power.#West should protect Libyan civilians
column2: not arm rebels. NATO Secretary-General Anders Fogh Rasmussen says the coalition under his control is clear about its mission. "We are not in Libya to arm people. We are in Libya to protect civilians against attacks".#0

column1: Solar energy is economically sound.#Solar energy is abundant. Every minute
column2: enough energy arrives at planet Earth to meet human energy demands for a year. It is
column4: the most abundant energy source available to humans. This abundance makes it an economic gem.#1

column1: Random breath tests help deter drunk driving. A 1995 review by the European Transport Safety Council concluded
column2: "There is wide agreement in the international scientific literature that increasing driver's perception of the risk of being detected for excess alcohol is a very important element in any package of measures to reduce alcohol related crashes".#Little evidence random alcohol tests deter drunk driving. There is a dearth of research regarding the deterrent effect of checkpoints. The only formally documented research regarding deterrence is a survey of Maryland's "Checkpoint Strikeforce" program. The survey found no deterrent effect: "To date
column3: there is no evidence to indicate that this campaign
column4: which involves a number of sobriety checkpoints and media activities to promote these efforts
column5: has had any impact on public perceptions
column7: or alcohol-related motor vehicle crashes and injuries. This conclusion is drawn after examining statistics for alcohol-related crashes
column9: and public perceptions of alcohol-impaired driving risk".#0

column1: Child beauty contests teach good life lessons.#Beauty contests can boost a child's self-esteem. The most cited reason parents give for putting their children into beauty pageants is to boost their child's self-esteem
